intro: Lasiosiphon multifolius, commonly known as the many-leaved lasiosiphon, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
